I want the app to be used by University staff and students with an ID that they hold on to as long as they are in the uni and even if they change roles between staff and students. The function would look like this:
THere would be an admin login and a user login. Here is an example of a typical usage. The admin would login, create a new space, give it a name and number, take photos of the space, add information of who manages the space, who are the academic supervisors, what are the access requirements, attach relevant documentation, add relevant links, and emergency procedures. The app will then generate a QR code that can be printed and displayed at the door of the space for other users to scan using the QR code and access the relevant information. The admin needs to be able to delete and create spaces. All users need to use the single sign on function assigned by the uni to sign in, and then depending on the role they have been assigned they will be signed in as admin or users. When a space is deleted, admin should be able to reactivate a space from a recycle bin. Users would sign in, scan the QR code on the door using the app, and then access the profile of that space with all the relevant information that an admin would have entered. THey can access the links and documents that are in there as well. Start with that and we can make adjustments as needed.

Okay, I understand. You want an app for university staff and students to manage and access information about university spaces. Here's a plan for the first version:

Features for the First Version:

-   Admin Login and Space Creation: Admins can log in, create new spaces with details like name, number, photos, manager/supervisor info, access requirements, documentation, links, and emergency procedures.
-   QR Code Generation: The app generates a QR code for each space that can be printed and displayed.
-   User Login and QR Code Scanning: Users log in via university single sign-on, scan QR codes, and access space information.

Design Elements:

-   Colors:
    -   Base color: Light gray or off-white for a clean background.
    -   Primary text color: Dark gray or black for readability.
    -   Accent colors: University's primary color for buttons and highlights.
-   Typography:
    -   Modern, clean fonts like "System" or "Roboto" for a professional look.
